page.title: 17Clevedon Craft Centre
page.content: Clevedon Craft Centre is situated in{ {Moor Lane,}just south of{Clevedon {Court.}It is owned by{Mr and Mrs {Huxtable,}who used to run it as a dairy farm, as their family had done for many years. In{1970}the{M5}was built across much of their land (and { {Mr Huxtable}became ill), forcing them to give up farming. However,{Mrs {Huxtable}loved the farmhouse and wanted her five children to grow up there. She saw an advertisement in the {Clevedon Mercury}from a silversmith requesting accomodation for his work. She offered him an unused barn and that was the start of the Craft Centre - in fact, this business is still thriving there along with such arts and crafts as glass blowing, diamond cutting etc. When you visit, you can see the crafts being demonstrated and buy the produce.
